article.headline: Colorado 96, UCF 87
article.story: The Associated Press BOULDER, Colo. (AP) -- A well-rested Colorado squad had six players score in double figures -- including 21 points from Kal Bay -- as the Buffaloes beat Central Florida 96-87 on Wednesday night. It's the first time the Buffaloes have played in 25 days due to a pair of snowstorms that blew through the state, canceling games against UC Davis and Texas Christian. Colorado hadn't played since a loss to Colorado State on Dec. 9. Josh Peppers and Jermaine Taylor each scored 22 points to lead the Golden Knights (10-3). Marcus King-Stockton had 18 points for Colorado (4-6) and Richard Roby added 14 points. Jermyl Jackson-Wilson (13 points), Dominique Coleman (12) and Jeremy Williams (10) also scored in double figures. Bay had six assists and was 5-for-10 from the 3-point line. The Buffs led 38-37 at halftime, but shot 65 percent in the second half to pull away from Central Florida in the first-ever meeting in basketball between the two schools. Colorado will open Big 12 play on Saturday as the team hosts Texas. The Buffaloes have not won a conference opener since Jan. 4, 1997, against Nebraska.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
